title: How to Make a Landsphere

steps.headline: Get a glass jar or bottle that is at least 3-liters.
steps.description: Then, wash your container with water only & dry it.

steps.headline: Add aquarium gravel, rinse it with water.
steps.description: Spread it in your bottle or jar about one inch deep. This will provide drainage for your plant roots.

steps.headline: Put half an inch of compost in your container.
steps.description: The compost has microorganisms that will decompose waste products.

steps.headline: Place in two inches of potting soil.
steps.description: This will provide burrowing areas for your animals.

steps.headline: Place the seeds of small plants in the soil of your landsphere.
steps.description: Do not use seeds of very tall plants. Water the seeds daily until they germinate.

steps.headline: Add animals.
After you put your animals in your landsphere, add water for the last time, seal it up, and don't open it again.

text:
Get a glass jar or bottle that is at least 3-liters. Then, wash your container with water only & dry it. Add aquarium gravel, rinse it with water. Spread it in your bottle or jar about one inch deep. This will provide drainage for your plant roots. Put half an inch of compost in your container. The compost has microorganisms that will decompose waste products. Place in two inches of potting soil. This will provide burrowing areas for your animals. Place the seeds of small plants in the soil of your landsphere. Do not use seeds of very tall plants. Water the seeds daily until they germinate. Add animals. Only put in two kids of animals.
